info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:12PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM MDT FOR EASTERN OTERO...SOUTHWESTERN KIOWA...EASTERN CROWLEY AND NORTHWESTERN BENT COUNTIES... At 609 PM MDT, Pueblo Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms located along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Wild Horse Point to Swink to near Higbee, moving northeast at 15 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR eastern Otero County. HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...La Junta ASOS measured an 87 mph wind gust. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. Locations impacted include... La Junta, North La Junta, Rocky Ford, Ordway, Swink, Sugar City, Cheraw and Higbee. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
